DBZ Abridged Joke Explanation / Voice Clarification

Episode 1: The Return of Radditz! ... Wait...

The episode is titled 'The Return of Radditz' despite Raditz never having actually been there in the first place.

0:55
Kame house... where the beaches are fine, and the bitches are even finer
0:55
Can you speak up? I'm not wearing any pants
A reference to Homer Simpson: "You'll have to speak up, I'm wearing a towel" Linky
0:41 Radditz: “Did Kakarot screw this up? Oh goddamnit, I knew we should have sent Turles”
Turles is the main antagonist of the movie Dragon Ball Z: The Tree of Might" who is a pretty big dbag.
0:55 Radditz: “Did Kakarot screw this up? Oh goddamnit, I knew we should have sent Turles”
Turles is the main antagonist of the movie Dragon Ball Z: The Tree of Might" who is a pretty big dbag.
1:30 Radditz: “So this is why dad said I couldn’t keep Appule”

Appule

Appule is a reptilian looking Frieza henchman. Apparently Raditz wanted to keep him as a pet, but Bardock thought he might accidentally kill him. His fears may have been unjustified, given that Radditz only ever became as strong as a saibaman

3:00 “DOUBLE SUN... [voice actors fight] fine... [first voice actor] I’m just gonna go practice my Vegeta. Ass.”

Double Sun... == Double Sunday. It's one of Raditz's attacks in DragonBall Z Budokai

As for the voice actor fighting, apparently there were two early DBZ dubs: the Ocean and Funimation dub

Lani begins to say Double Sunday when he is interrupted by Vegeta3986 who then takes over the role, if you listen closely, you can recognize the voice change.

This seems to be a reference to the two dubs.

In the Funimation Dub, Chris Sabat voiced Vegeta, and also Raditz once when he made a reappearance in episode 89. Lani also voices Vegeta and started out voicing raditz before being overtaken by Vegeta3986

3:44 I'm drinking OJ! Now it's Apple Juice! Now it's beer!

source

4:36 [M Night's face pops onto the screen] What a twist!
A double reference to Robot Chicken and the great M Night Shamaam... Shamyalian... shamalamading... oh to hell with it! He's most famous for creating movies with crazy twists, like the Sixth Sense. Also a recurring joke on Reddit.

source

2:01 Ha ha! Dangly parts.
"It's from Harvey Birdman Attorney at Law. The character, and show in general, is based on really random things" source
3:29 Piccolo: (singing) Da da dah da...

Piccolo is singing the Mah Nà Mah Nà song source

6:15 Piccolo: "Makansa... makans apappa... makansappa... oh to hell with it! Special beam cannon!"

Piccolo was trying to say "Makankosappo", but could not pronounce it correctly. "Makankosappo" is the original japanese name for the "Special Beam Cannon". source

6:28 Riiiiccolaa... ahwwhhhhhaa!

A reference to the ricola losange ad Piccolo was trying to say "Makankosappo", but could not pronounce it correctly. "Makankosappo" is the original japanese name for the "Special Beam Cannon". source

Episode 3: Happily Ever Afterlife

0:22 Nappa: Guy who's as strong as a saibaman says what?

A Saibaman (not to be confused with Saiyaman)

Saibamen are green humanoid characters that can be grown from a liquid concoction. Nappa grows them to fight against the Earthlings. Each is as strong as Raditz. That's right, Raditz was so weak, they could actually grow Raditzes.
0:22 King Yemma: Mahogany!

This guy has the best explanation. Yemma is bragging about a real-world material, despite the fact he's an otherworldly being.

0:22 King Yemma: Mahogany!

A Saibaman (not to be confused with Saiyaman)

Saibamen are green humanoid characters that can be grown from a liquid concoction. Nappa grows them to fight against the Earthlings. Each is as strong as Raditz. That's right, Raditz was so weak, they could actually grow Raditzes.
6:37 King Yemma: And not just any Mahogany, but mahogany from Malchior 7 where the trees are 300 ft tall and breathe fire. From these trees my desk was forged 2000 years ago using ancient blood rituals of the Malchior people.

Just another play on the mahogany joke. Malchior 7 doesn't seem to be a reference to anything (according to Google)the face on the malchior. The face on the malchior people is Lanipator

Episode 4: Snakeway to Heaven

1:13 Goz and Mez: we are here to [clap], pump you up!

A reference to the Germany homoerotic duo Hans and Franz of SNL (who are themselves parodies of Arnold Schwarzenegger) and Goz and Mez's similarities to them. 'Ach nein!' translates to 'Oh no!'

1:13 Nappa:Are there yet?
Vegeta: No.
[repeat]

A reference to the Simpsons Hans and Franz of SNL (who are themselves parodies of Arnold Schwarzenegger) and Goz and Mez's similarities to them. 'Ach nein!' translates to 'Oh no!'

Episdoe 5: Vegeta: Kills Bugs Dead

4:08 Arlian[voice clarification]: Welcome to Oz, bitch!
4:08 (Barbara Streisand’s “The Way We Were” plays) Barbara Streisand: Memories, light the corners of my mind, misty watercolor memories of the way we were.

Barbara Streisand.

Episode 6: No One Ever Listens To The Magical Dragon

4:08 Helmet: You must construct additional pylons.
5:23 Bulma: I don’t get it. Why are we doing this again? Master Roshi: Because my sister Baba told us to.
Roshi's siser Baba is a fortune teller. Knowing the future, she tells Roshi to make this happen.

Episode 7: Saiyans? On My Planet? (It's More Likely Than You Think).

According to Know your Meme, the joke stems from an old ad: http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/x-in-my-y
4:31 Jimmy: Oh my god, he blew up the cargo robot! ...and the cargo was PEOPLE!

In the Ocean Dub, due to their steadfast refusal to mention death, they said that Nappa blew up a cargo robot [1] source

Nappa: But, Vegeta, then you have to worry about the Fraggles. Vegeta: Oh God damn it, Nappa, nobody’s going to get that. Tien: [off screen with echo] As a matter of fact... Tien: I did.

Fraggles are characters from the Muppet show Fraggle Rock, which eat radishes. Nappa mistakes 'Raditz' for 'Radish' (Raditz's name is based off the word Radish)

Vegeta: They’re cultivated life forms. All with the same power level as Raditz. That’s right; he was so weak, we could actually grow Raditzes! Nappa: But, Vegeta, then you have to worry about the Fraggles. Vegeta: Oh God damn it, Nappa, nobody’s going to get that. Tien: [off screen with echo] As a matter of fact... Tien: I did.

Fraggle Five

Fraggles are humanoid characters from the Muppet show Fraggle Rock that eat radishes. Nappa's joke mistakes 'Raditz' for 'Radish' (Raditz's name is a pun on the word 'Radish'). This joke is the second Muppet reference in DBZ abridged (the first being Piccolo singing the 'Mahna Mahna' song )

Episode 8: Nappa's Best Day Ever

1:15 Krillin: That’s it! I can’t take it anymore! I can only be pushed so far! **video game select for Krillin** Krillin: KRILLIN LIMIT BREEEEEAK!!!! (uses scatter shot) **victory music from FF7**

A reference to Final Fantasy 7. Your character got closer and closer to its 'limit' as it took damage. Once the character reached its 'limit' it could perform a special attack. After Krillin destroys his opponent, the victory music from FF7 is played

1:15 Nappa: Vegeta! The Pokémon’s on my back. Tien: Chiaotzu! No! Nappa: I can’t get it off, Vegeta! Here, I’ll use Rock Smash.

As TFS is fond of Pokemon references, this could very well be reference to Rock Smash

4:27 Krillin: Piccolo...do you have a plan? Piccolo: That depends. Can you get him in a Full Nelson? Krillin: Any plans that don’t involve killing me? Piccolo: Well, there is the Multi-Form technique. Krillin: But doesn’t that cut our power levels by... Piccolo: Plan A or Plan B, Krillin? Krillin: Plan B, Plan B!! Piccolo and Krillin: KAGEBUSHIN NO JUTSU! Nappa: Vegeta! I can’t....”Believe it”.

A few jokes here.

  1. "Full Nelson" is reference to episode 2 where Goku gets Raditz in a full nelson, and Piccolo blasts both of them.
  2. "KAGEBUSHIN NO JUTSU!" is reference to the Shadow Clone Technique from Naruto.
  3. "Believe it" is Naruto's catch phrase

5:43 Tien: You stupid...ugly...son of a bitch. His name... was Chiaotzu. KIKOHO!!!!!!

Fun fact: Kikoho roughly translates to 'Energy Control Cannon'. See Tri Beam

5:43 Vegeta: Nappa, where did your armor go? Nappa: I had a hell of a day, Vegeta. I sank their battleship......and their whales. Aquaman (offscreen): Nooooooooooooo.......

'battleship' is a reference to the game Battleship in which one can sink an opponents battleships

Aquaman screaming 'noooooooo' is a reference to episode 5 ,where the super friends convene to stop the Saiyans, and all Aquaman can only offer is his ability to speak to whales.

Episode 9: The Set Up

1:25 Nappa: Midget’s next! RHAAAA!!! Krillin: My turn, my turn, MY TURN! Nappa: Oh! Vegeta: What- Nappa, what are you doing? Nappa: It’s his turn Vegeta, I have to wait for him.

I believe this is another FF7 reference, in which each side takes turns attacking.

3:37 Nappa: Oh you-a-making-me-so-mad! Vegeta, look. I’ma firing my BLARGH (face turns into Shoop the Whoop)

Shoop the Whoop (aka I’M A’ FIRIN’ MAH LAZER) is a meme from the Cell Saga. http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/shoop-da-whoop-i%E2%80%99m-a%E2%80%99-firin%E2%80%99-mah-lazer

Not sure where the you-a-making-me-so-mad comes from. Maybe I Love Lucy?

Episode 10: Part 1: The Punchline

0:41 Goku: Yes, Gohan. Tell her. ("Coming Undone" by KoRn plays) To put dinner on. ("Coming Undone" plays again) ‘Cause I’m hungry. (plays a third time)

Just wanted to reference the song

6:03
Narrator: Meanwhile, back at the ranch.
Bulma: Remember when we used to do stuff? You know? Be out there with them? And help?
*They all agree*
Oolong: And remember the Red Ribbon Army?
*They all remember*
Roshi: And what about King Piccolo?
* They all remember*
Bulma: Good times. Good times… Whatever happened to Launch?
(There is silence)
Roshi: Who?

Meanwhile, back at the ranch ... is a phrase frequently used by narrators of American cowboy movies and TV shows as a segue from one scene to another.

Here's some links to The Red Ribbon Army, King Piccolo and Launch

6:03
Krillin: Ah, Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter.

Apparently Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter is a real film

Episode 10: Part 3: Finale

Researcher 1: So mister Spock, what do you make, of this...ship? Researcher 2: Well sir, I find it highly illogical to refer to this as a “ship”; the spherical design incorporates no propulsion system. It looks more like an orbiting vessel, or a satell—whaaa! Researcher 1: … suck it, Spock!

I believe they are referencing the fact that the scientists are jolting around awkwardly, in a similar way that Family Guy portrays Captain Kirk. Not entirely sure.
